alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 2:55PM CDT until May 19 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT FOR CRAWFORD COUNTY... At 254 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Cherryville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Spotters reported peas to penny size hail near Steelville. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe storm will be near... Steelville around 310 PM CDT. Cuba around 320 PM CDT. Bourbon and Leasburg around 330 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Oak Hill, St. Cloud and Cook Station. This also includes Onondaga Cave State Park. This includes Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 203 and 218. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for east central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
